posts.post_content:
This is what happens when you put a [Steel Wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Wall), a [Wall of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Hope) and [Noble Stand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Stand) in a bowl, refine everything with a decent creature type, then add a pinch of awesome and finally stir everything up.  
  
Oh, and keep in mind he's cúmulative with himself. This means if you cast him on turn one and fetch two further captains with [Ranger of Eos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ranger of Eos), you'll get 6 life each time you block with one of them.
posts.html:
This is what happens when you put a Steel Wall, a Wall of Hope and Noble Stand in a bowl, refine everything with a decent creature type, then add a pinch of awesome and finally stir everything up.

Oh, and keep in mind he's cúmulative with himself. This means if you cast him on turn one and fetch two further captains with Ranger of Eos, you'll get 6 life each time you block with one of them.

posts.post_content: I like this card, because it a perfect white flavored card (in contrast to [Loam Lion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loam Lion)). Even if it's crearly a bit overpowered, it doesn't focus on a 'kill opponent in 5sek' strategy... and this is a rarity by now.

Posted By: Cheza (3/16/2010 5:30:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Use this in my Open the Vaults deck, in sideboard along with Rest for the Weary against RDW and faster aggro decks. He is beastly against RDW. He's out of bolt range and completely negates the presence of Hellspark and Guide on Turn 2. Makes a turn 1 Guide look stupid. Only problem is he gets bolt'd while blocking. WoD is great and avoids such problems, but comes out a little too late against RDW in my opinion and can be hard to cast. Captain does the job from turn 1. I should consider making room for both in the sideboard, make myself RDW-proof.   
  
I can see this guy being used in side in WW too. He's just great.
posts.html:

He's out of bolt range and completely negates the presence of Hellspark and Guide on Turn 2. Makes a turn 1 Guide look stupid. Only problem is he gets bolt'd while blocking. WoD is great and avoids such problems, but comes out a little too late against RDW in my opinion and can be hard to cast. Captain does the job from turn 1. I should consider making room for both in the sideboard, make myself RDW-proof.

I can see this guy being used in side in WW too. He's just great.

posts.post_content:
This card have potential.
  
   
Just imagine if you have 2x of these, rage nimbus and vent sentinel.
  
   
Use rage nimbus to force one of their creature to atack.
  
   
   
Block with all 4 defenders.
  
   
Perimter captain gives you each 2 life for each defender blocking. That's 2\*2\*4 = 16 life gained.
  
   
Finish off with using vent sentinels activated ability and pinging an opponent for 4.

posts.post_content:
*For those that say that Wall of Steel is awesome with this card should realize that Wall of Steel doesn't actually have defender.  
Just says its a wall*  
  
And all creatures that are of the type "wall" gained defender as a retroactive errata, so according to the rules it is a defender the same as any other. Isn't the glossary a wonderful thing?
posts.html:
For those that say that Wall of Steel is awesome with this card should realize that Wall of Steel doesn't actually have defender.

Use this in my Open the Vaults deck, in sideboard along with Rest for the Weary against RDW and faster aggro decks. He is beastly against RDW. He's out of bolt range and completely negates the presence of Hellspark and Guide on Turn 2. Makes a turn 1 Guide look stupid. Only problem is he gets bolt'd while blocking.
